oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A certain old woman named /xannan-/xannan, who had power over the wind. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-23. 5842 rev., 5845, 5845 rev. and 5846 rev.). The protection extended by the Wind to /xannan-/xannan. (L V.-23. 5862-5871). About the old woman called |xannan |xannan (or =na a -an) and what she did with the wind when the people scolded her and made her angry. Dia!kwain's grandfather would ask |xannan |xannan to open her kaross so that the wind would blow out of it and blow away the mosquitos which kept him awake at night.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: |xannan |xannan and the wind
